properties.areaDesc: Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu; Manua
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 6:48AM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Windy conditions, the potential for flash flooding, and coastal
hazards will increase this weekend and will continue into next
week. The windy conditions have the potential to blow down trees,
down power lines, blow around loose objects, Damage roofs, small
out-buildings, tents, and outdoor kitchen, travel will be
difficult especially for high profile vehicles. Frequent rain may
create flash flooding to cause flooded roadways and overflowing
streams across the territory, landslides, and cause structures
to be inundated. We expect hazardous seas which will create high
surf conditions along with gale force winds along American Samoa
coastal waters. These conditions will be hazardous to small
crafts, cause strong rip currents, and may capsize or damage
vessels.

American Samoa is in the middle of hurricane season. It is
important to actively listen for forthcoming information from your
National Weather Service Office and TEMCO for latest information.
You may also contact EOC at 699-3800 for more precautionary and
preparedness actions. Please visit our website at weather.gov/ppg
and follow us on Facebook @NWSPagoPago

NWSheadline: Damaging weather conditions expected for American Samoa
